etymologies: Old English. Apparently from bruise + wort, perhaps so named with reference to its healing properties

definitions: Originally: either of two plants, comfrey, Symphytum officinale, and the common daisy, Bellis perennis. In later use also: soapwort, Saponaria officinalis (now rare).

notes.text: Both comfrey and the common daisy have been used in the treatment of wounds and bruises and of diseases of the lungs.
